pages.text: §lRockbreaker!§r The hammer is used to break down materials into their constituent parts. In other words, smashing things to bits. This is particularly useful for $(thing)pulverising ores$() into dusts that can then be combined to allow $(thing)creation of alloys$().$(br)Soon, you will be able to build a machine that automates this repetitive rock breaking.

The hammer is also useful in $(thing)shaping metals$() for use in machines - hammering ingots will create plates. In addition, the hammer can be used to $(thing)mine$() ore blocks in the world and they will drop dust.
